meanings.definition: A photographic process in which a plate is coated with a light-sensitive gelatin tissue that has been exposed to a film positive and then hardened.
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed beautiful collotypes of flowers and landscapes.
meanings.sent2: She admired the collotypes of old buildings in the art gallery.
meanings.sent3: The collotypes of animals seemed to come to life on the paper.
meanings.sent4: The collotypes captured the essence of nature in stunning detail.
meanings.sent5: The collotypes revealed intricate patterns and textures with clarity.

meanings.definition: Prints made using the collotype process.
meanings.sent1: The bookstore had a collection of collotypes featuring famous paintings.
meanings.sent2: He purchased a set of collotypes to decorate his living room.
meanings.sent3: The collotypes on the wall added a touch of elegance to the room.
meanings.sent4: Her collection of collotypes brought color and beauty to the space.
meanings.sent5: The collotypes on display showcased the artist's talent and skill.
